content.description: Sit start with the jug sidepull. From there, follow the arete, staying on the west face, to the boulder's top and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a rock that requires some attention.
content.location: It climbs the west arete of Woodrow.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, ascend the slab using block's sidepulls and edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Woodrow.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand on a sloper and a right hand on a sidepull.  From there, work up the arete using the right hand sidepulls, then reach the crimp and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two, two is probably best, as it would level out the rocky landing.
content.location: It is located on the southwestern arete.

content.description: Sit start with a sloping right hand sidepull and a left hand on the arete's bumps. From there, climb straight up using the left hand arete and an edge on the face to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there are rocks right of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Woodrow.

content.description:
Start matched on good edge with poor feet. From there, reach right hand jug (nearly campusing), move up to features above, then the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.

You may traverse in from the start of

Mother Was a Mudder

. I didn't see the line until I posted the beta photo here.
content.protection: At least a few pads. The landing is poor due to rocks.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Woodrow.

content.description:
Sit start with a pair of good edges. From there, bump the left hand into a great sidepull, reach the shelf, follow to the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.

For what it's worth, the problem climbs a section of rock that may be loose. I climbed it and didn't feel any movement, but I'm not certain how well it's attached to the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. There is good landing with some rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the center of Woodrow's east face.

content.description: Sit start with a jug. From there, stick a big right hand to a sloper, continue bumping it to the jug, and finish up the remainder for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there is a rock directly behind the problem.

content.description: Stand start with a small, right hand crimp and a left hand undercling.  Use thin feet to gain a left hand sidepull-undercling, stand tall on a small edge, then reach a right hand to a crimp high up and top out the solid slab.  Wingspan size is a big factor on this one.
content.protection: Pad or two and spot, the landing is great.
content.location: It is located at the center, west-face of the Woodrow Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand sidepull-edge and a left hand pocket-bump. From there, gain a left hand edge, match a right hand near it on a great edge, bump to a left hand edge, then reach a nice right hand diagonal feature below the lip, and mantel onto the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is quite good.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Woodrow.
